{"id": "10021503", "categories": [{"id": 107, "label": "dmoz/Business/Business Services/Fire and Security", "uri": "dmoz/Business/Business_Services/Fire_and_Security", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711798771", "source": {"id": "104", "title": "Washington Post", "uri": "washingtonpost.com"}, "url": "https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/the-latest-florida-authorities-say-4-police-officers-shot/2017/08/19/ee5f67c2-8497-11e7-9e7a-20fa8d7a0db6_story.html", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. -- The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n1:22 a.m.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\n12:50 a.m.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\n___\n\n12:15 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonsville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\no\n\n___\n\n11:30 p.m.\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. {"id": "10065983", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711919759", "source": {"id": "11193", "title": "Dothan Eagle", "uri": "dothaneagle.com"}, "url": "http://www.dothaneagle.com/news/ap/national/the-latest-suspect-charged-in-florida-police-shooting/article_4ab009c1-5276-5d7a-a26a-147d68026d40.html", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) -- The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n9:10 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\n-- -- --\n\n8:30 a.m.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\n-- -- --\n\n2:55 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\n-- -- --\n\n1:22 a.m.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. {"id": "10024506", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 336, "label": "dmoz/Shopping/Office Products/Furniture", "uri": "dmoz/Shopping/Office_Products/Furniture", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711806573", "source": {"id": "1806", "title": "tristateupdate.com", "uri": "tristateupdate.com"}, "url": "http://www.tristateupdate.com/story/36171829/the-latest-jacksonville-shooting-leaves-2-officers-injured", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n2:55 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonsville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. {"id": "10126442", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-20", "uri": "712097484", "source": {"id": "114", "title": "WHBQ", "uri": "fox13memphis.com"}, "url": "http://www.fox13memphis.com/news/the-latest-florida-gov-heartbroken-after-4-officers-shot/595025797", "body": "Authorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semiautomatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. {"id": "10102318", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "712020802", "source": {"id": "81", "title": "TimesDaily", "uri": "timesdaily.com"}, "url": "http://www.timesdaily.com/news/nation/the-latest-nd-officer-dies-from-shooting-in-fla/article_5e569a4b-5ff3-5b8c-8560-5b51742194c0.html", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) -- The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n3:15 p.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\n-- -- --\n\n11:50 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semiautomatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\n-- -- --\n\n9:10 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\n-- -- --\n\n8:30 a.m.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\n-- -- --\n\n2:55 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\n-- -- --\n\n1:22 a.m.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\n-- -- --\n\n12:50 a.m.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\n-- -- --\n\n12:15 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonsville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\no\n\n-- -- --\n\n11:30 p.m.\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles {"id": "10102310", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "712020794", "source": {"id": "214", "title": "Mail Online", "uri": "dailymail.co.uk"}, "url": "http://www.dailymail.co.uk/~/article-4805744/index.html", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n3:15 p.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\n___\n\n11:50 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semiautomatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\n___\n\n9:10 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\n___\n\n8:30 a.m.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\n___\n\n2:55 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. (AP) -- The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n4:25 p.m.\n\nTwo Florida police officers were fatally shot in a district where the top prosecutor says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nThe announcement came as her office was building a case against Markeith Loyd, who is charged with the fatal shooting of an Orlando Police lieutenant.\n\nEverett Miller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\n-- -- --\n\n4 p.m.\n\nA U.S. congressman from Florida says he plans to ask for a moment of silence on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives to honor two officers who were killed on patrol.\n\nU.S. Rep. Darren Soto said Saturday that American flags will be flown over the U.S. Capitol to honor Sgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department.\n\nHoward died Saturday from his injuries and Baxter died Friday night, shortly after he was shot.\n\nAuthorities have charged 45-year-old Everett Miller with first-degree murder.\n\n-- -- --\n\n3:15 p.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\n-- -- --\n\n11:50 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semi-automatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\n-- -- --\n\n9:10 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\n-- -- --\n\n8:30 a.m.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\n-- -- --\n\n2:55 a.m.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\n-- -- --\n\n1:22 a.m.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\n-- -- --\n\n12:50 a.m.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\n-- -- --\n\n12:48 a.m.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\n-- -- --\n\n12:15 a.m.\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 {"id": "10102116", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "712018988", "source": {"id": "191", "title": "WMC Action News 5", "uri": "wmcactionnews5.com"}, "url": "http://www.wmcactionnews5.com/story/36171790/the-latest-2nd-officer-dies-from-shooting-in-florida", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n3:15 p.m.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semiautomatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonsville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. {"id": "10107011", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "712035899", "source": {"id": "19270", "title": "WBOC TV 16", "uri": "wboc.com"}, "url": "http://www.wboc.com/story/36171790/the-latest-no-death-penalty-in-area-where-officers-killed", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n4:25 p.m.\n\nTwo Florida police officers were fatally shot in a district where the top prosecutor says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nThe announcement came as her office was building a case against Markeith Loyd, who is charged with the fatal shooting of an Orlando Police lieutenant.\n\nEverett Miller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\nA U.S. congressman from Florida says he plans to ask for a moment of silence on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives to honor two officers who were killed on patrol.\n\nU.S. Rep. Darren Soto said Saturday that American flags will be flown over the U.S. Capitol to honor Sgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department.\n\nHoward died Saturday from his injuries and Baxter died Friday night, shortly after he was shot.\n\nAuthorities have charged 45-year-old Everett Miller with first-degree murder.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semi-automatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. {"id": "10060861", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711907023", "source": {"id": "191", "title": "WMC Action News 5", "uri": "wmcactionnews5.com"}, "url": "http://www.wmcactionnews5.com/story/36171830/the-latest-trump-offers-support-to-kissimmee-pd", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n8:30 a.m.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonsville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. The other two officers were injured a couple of hours later in Jacksonville, one of them shot in both hands and the other in the stomach. Three of four suspects in the Kissimmee shooting were arrested, and the shooter in Jacksonville was shot and killed when police returned fire.\n\nIn Kissimmee, officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspects in an area of the city for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. Both had families, he said.\n\nThe officers were checking three of the suspects when a fourth opened fire. One of the original three suspects fled and was being sought, and the other three were arrested. Broadcaster WFTV showed aerial footage of police cars with lights flashing swarmed a housing complex as the search continued early Saturday morning.\n\nIn the northern Florida city of Jacksonville, police responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home where three other people were thought to be in danger, Sheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno said.\n\nA team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house, Bruno said. The suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in the exchange of fire. The three other people in the house were safe, Bruno said.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott sent Tweets about the four officers, saying \"we stand with ALL law enforcement in Florida.\"\n\nWhen O'Dell held his brief news conference outside the hospital where the two fallen Kissimmee officers had been taken, reports already had surfaced of two more officers shot in Jacksonville to the north.\n\n\"It's a tough time for law enforcement,\" O'Dell said of those reports. {"id": "10070696", "categories": [{"id": 107, "label": "dmoz/Business/Business Services/Fire and Security", "uri": "dmoz/Business/Business_Services/Fire_and_Security", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711933733", "source": {"id": "1267", "title": "KSHB", "uri": "kshb.com"}, "url": "http://www.kshb.com/news/national/4-police-officers-shot-in-separate-florida-cities-overnight-at-least-1-dead", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) -- One police officer was killed and three wounded in nighttime shootings in two Florida cities where the officers were responding to suspected drug activity and reports of a suicide attempt, police said Saturday.\n\nOne officer was killed and another gravely injured late Friday night in Kissimmee in central Florida just south of the theme park hub of Orlando. The other two officers were injured a couple of hours later in Jacksonville, one of them shot in both hands and the other in the stomach. All four suspects in the Kissimmee shooting were eventually arrested, and the shooter in Jacksonville was shot and killed when police returned fire.\n\nIn Kissimmee, officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspects in an area of the city for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. Both had families, he said.\n\nThe officers were checking three of the suspects when a fourth opened fire. One of the original three suspects fled and was being sought, and the other three were arrested. Broadcaster WFTV showed aerial footage of police cars with lights flashing swarmed a housing complex as the search continued early Saturday morning.\n\nIn the northern Florida city of Jacksonville, police responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home where three other people were thought to be in danger, Sheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno said.\n\nA team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house, Bruno said. The suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in the exchange of fire. The three other people in the house were safe, Bruno said.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott sent Tweets about the four officers, saying \"we stand with ALL law enforcement in Florida.\"\n\nWhen O'Dell held his brief news conference outside the hospital where the two fallen Kissimmee officers had been taken, reports already had surfaced of two more officers shot in Jacksonville to the north.\n\n\"It's a tough time for law enforcement,\" O'Dell said of those reports. AP\n\nElsewhere in Florida, two police officers were shot and injured when responding to shots fired in Jacksonville.\n\nKissimmee police officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspicious people in an area of the city known for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. {"id": "10123599", "categories": [{"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-20", "uri": "712088567", "source": {"id": "566", "title": "Associated Press", "uri": "hosted2.ap.org"}, "url": "http://hosted2.ap.org/CARIE/6b85546689744819aa7a64cd3ca6cee6/Article_2017-08-19-US--Officers%20Shot-Florida-The%20Latest/id-a60551a15a0b4df48da30ab8ef3c6c9d", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. (AP) -- The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n8:30 p.m.\n\nFlorida's governor has issued an executive order reassigning the case of a man accused of killing two police officers from the top prosecutor who says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nGov. Rick Scott issued the order Saturday evening, taking the case of Everett Miller from State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nMiller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\nTwo Florida police officers were fatally shot in a district where the top prosecutor says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nThe announcement came as her office was building a case against Markeith Loyd, who is charged with the fatal shooting of an Orlando Police lieutenant.\n\nEverett Miller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\nA U.S. congressman from Florida says he plans to ask for a moment of silence on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives to honor two officers who were killed on patrol.\n\nU.S. Rep. Darren Soto said Saturday that American flags will be flown over the U.S. Capitol to honor Sgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department.\n\nHoward died Saturday from his injuries and Baxter died Friday night, shortly after he was shot.\n\nAuthorities have charged 45-year-old Everett Miller with first-degree murder.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semi-automatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. {"id": "10092823", "categories": [{"id": 107, "label": "dmoz/Business/Business Services/Fire and Security", "uri": "dmoz/Business/Business_Services/Fire_and_Security", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711994202", "source": {"id": "622", "title": "Denver7", "uri": "thedenverchannel.com"}, "url": "http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/u-s-world/1-police-officer-killed-5-injured-in-shootings-in-florida-pennsylvania", "body": "KISSIMMEE, Fla. -- One police officer was killed and three wounded in nighttime shootings in two Florida cities while two Pennsylvania state troopers were wounded in Fairchance.\n\nThe Florida officers were responding to suspected drug activity and reports of a suicide attempt, police said Saturday.\n\nOne officer was killed and another gravely injured late Friday night in Kissimmee in central Florida just south of the theme park hub of Orlando. The other two officers were injured a couple of hours later in Jacksonville, one of them shot in both hands and the other in the stomach. Three of four suspects in the Kissimmee shooting were arrested, and the shooter in Jacksonville was shot and killed when police returned fire.\n\nIn Kissimmee, officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspects in an area of the city for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. Both had families, he said.\n\nThe officers were checking three of the suspects when a fourth opened fire. One of the original three suspects fled and was being sought, and the other three were arrested. Broadcaster WFTV showed aerial footage of police cars with lights flashing swarmed a housing complex as the search continued early Saturday morning.\n\nIn the northern Florida city of Jacksonville, police responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home where three other people were thought to be in danger, Sheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno said.\n\nA team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house, Bruno said. The suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in the exchange of fire. The three other people in the house were safe, Bruno said.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott sent Tweets about the four officers, saying \"we stand with ALL law enforcement in Florida.\"\n\nWhen O'Dell held his brief news conference outside the hospital where the two fallen Kissimmee officers had been taken, reports already had surfaced of two more officers shot in Jacksonville to the north.\n\n\"It's a tough time for law enforcement,\" O'Dell said of those reports. \"It's getting tough to do the job.\"\n\nThe Pennsylvania troopers were serving a warrant when one was shot in the stomach and the other was shot in the hand. (AP) - The Latest on police officers shot in Florida (all times local):\n\n8:30 p.m.\n\nFlorida's governor has issued an executive order reassigning the case of a man accused of killing two police officers from the top prosecutor who says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nGov. Rick Scott issued the order Saturday evening, taking the case of Everett Miller from State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nMiller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\nTwo Florida police officers were fatally shot in a district where the top prosecutor says she is no longer seeking the death penalty.\n\nSgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department were shot late Friday in the district covered by State Attorney Aramis Ayala.\n\nAyala announced earlier this year that she wouldn't seek the death penalty, explaining it's not a deterrent and it drags on for years for the victims' relatives.\n\nThe announcement came as her office was building a case against Markeith Loyd, who is charged with the fatal shooting of an Orlando Police lieutenant.\n\nEverett Miller is facing a first-degree murder charge for the Kissimmee shootings. He was arrested late Friday.\n\nA spokeswoman for Ayala didn't respond to an email inquiry seeking comment.\n\nA U.S. congressman from Florida says he plans to ask for a moment of silence on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives to honor two officers who were killed on patrol.\n\nU.S. Rep. Darren Soto said Saturday that American flags will be flown over the U.S. Capitol to honor Sgt. Sam Howard and Officer Matthew Baxter of the Kissimmee Police Department.\n\nHoward died Saturday from his injuries and Baxter died Friday night, shortly after he was shot.\n\nAuthorities have charged 45-year-old Everett Miller with first-degree murder.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a second officer has died, a day after he and a colleague were shot during a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says Sgt. Sam Howard died Saturday from his injuries.\n\nHis colleague, Officer Matthew Baxter, died Friday night after the attack in a neighborhood of Kissimmee, which is located south of the theme park hub of Orlando.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot in north Florida have a long journey to recovery.\n\nJacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said Saturday that officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell are in stable condition following Friday night's confrontation with an armed man who was killed by the officers.\n\nWilliams said at a news conference that the suspect, Derrick Brabham, was making threats inside a home with the mother of his child, their 19-month-old baby, the woman's mother and a family friend. None of them were injured.\n\nAfter officers arrived at the home, they heard gunfire from inside and decided to enter the house.\n\nThe sheriff says Brabham opened fire with a semi-automatic rifle as they entered the house.\n\nSeparately, in central Florida, a Kissimmee police officer was killed and his sergeant wounded following a scuffle with a suspect.\n\nAuthorities in Florida say a suspect has been arrested in the fatal shooting of a police officer and the grave wounding of another officer.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said Saturday that Everett Miller was arrested several hours after the shootings late Friday in this city south of Orlando.\n\nHe faces a first-degree murder charge.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nO'Dell says Officer Matthew Baxter was fatally shot and Officer Sam Howard was wounded during a scuffle with Miller while on patrol.\n\nPresident Trump says his thoughts and prayers are with a police department in Florida where one officer was fatally shot and another was gravely wounded.\n\nTrump tweeted early Saturday to the Kissimmee Police Department, \"We are with you!\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott tweeted he was heartbroken by the news of Officer Matthew Baxter's death late Friday in central Florida, and he was praying for a quick recovery for Officer Sam Howard.\n\nSeparately, two officers were shot and wounded in the north Florida city of Jacksonville late Friday.\n\nAuthorities say two officers who were shot and wounded had responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home in the northern Florida city of Jacksonville where three other people were thought to be in danger inside.\n\nSheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno says a team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house. He says the suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in that exchange of fire.\n\nBruno says the three other people in the house were safe.\n\nOne of the officers was shot in both hands, and the other shot in the stomach.\n\nPolice say one police officer was shot and killed and another was gravely injured by gunfire while checking suspicious people in central Florida. Three suspects are in custody and a fourth is being sought.\n\nKissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference early Saturday morning that officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking people in an area of Kissimmee known for drug activity when they were shot. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\nO'Dell says Baxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year-veteran, was in serious condition.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott said on his official Twitter account that he is \"Heartbroken to hear of the loss\" of two police officers in in Kissimmee, in central Florida.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department said the two officers were shot in a downtown area, but did not immediately disclose further details. The department said the police chief would give a briefing later in the night.\n\nScott also said that two police officers who had been shot in the northern city of Jacksonville were \"in danger.\"\n\nAuthorities in northern Florida say two police officers have been shot in Jacksonville.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said on its official Twitter site that two police officers were shot in the west side of the city.\n\nNo further details were available. The Twitter feed said: *\"We will update as soon as we can.\"\n\nFlorida authorities say two Kissimmee police officers have been shot.\n\nThe Kissimmee Police Department says via its official Twitter site Friday night that the officers were shot in the area of Palmway and Cypress.\n\nNo further information was immediately available.\n\nKissimmee is about 23 miles (37.01 kilometers) south of Orlando.\n\nCopyright 2017 The Associated Press. Sam Howard in Kissimmee, Florida on Friday night.\n\nThe former serviceman allegedly shot and killed Baxter, 27, and critically wounded Howard, 36, in the attack.\n\nMiller was arrested at a nearby bar later that night and now faces a charge of first-degree murder for killing Baxter and could face other charges for wounding Howard.\n\nMiller was recently involuntarily committed for a mental evaluation by the Osceola County Sheriff's Office. He also made threats to law enforcement officials on Facebook, police said.\n\nHoward, who remains in critical condition at a hospital, may not survive his injuries.\n\nPolice Chief Jeff O'Dell said on Saturday: 'It's grave. Howard, who remains in critical condition at a hospital, may not survive his injuries\n\nPolice Chief Jeff O'Dell suggested that the two officers were ambushed and did not return fire. Two officers stand guard outside the Osceola Regional Medical Center in Kissimmee\n\nDuring a patrol late Friday of a neighborhood with a history of drug activity, Baxter was 'checking out' three people, including Miller, when the officer got into a scuffle with Miller. Howard, his sergeant, responded as backup, the police chief said.\n\nThe officers didn't have an opportunity to return fire. They weren't wearing body cameras.\n\nSheriff's deputies with a neighboring law enforcement agency later tracked Miller down to a bar and approached him. Miller started reaching toward his waistband when the deputies tackled and subdued him, O'Dell said.\n\nThe found a handgun and revolver on him.\n\n'They were extremely brave and heroic actions taken by the deputies,' O'Dell said.\n\nThe police chief said Miller would be taken to jail wearing the fallen officer's handcuffs.\n\nAuthorities originally said they believed there were four suspects, but the chief said Saturday that no other arrests are anticipated.\n\nAs of Saturday morning, Howard was in 'grave, critical condition' at the hospital, O'Dell said.\n\nBaxter (center) was shot and killed in the Florida town on an unusually violent night that saw another five police officers get shot in three different US cities\n\nFellow Kissimmee officer Sam Howard (pictured) was severely injured during the ambush\n\nAnother Kissimmee officer was shot, as well as two other officers in nearby Jacksonville\n\nTwo state troopers were also shot in Fairchance, Pennsylvania (pictured) on the same night\n\nBaxter had been with the Kissimmee Police Department for three years. He was married to another Kissimmee police officer and they have four children.\n\nHoward has served with the Kissimmee Police Department for 10 years. He and his wife have one child, O'Dell said.\n\n'They are two wonderful men, family men,' O'Dell said. Husband/father/hero. Praying for @kissimmeepolice,' he wrote in another tweet.\n\nOf the two officers shot during a separate incident in Jacksonville around 11pm. One is in stable condition and another is in critical condition.\n\nThe Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said the officers were dispatched for an attempted suicide call.\n\nWhen officers approached the scene, gunfire could be heard inside the home. The officers then entered the residence.\n\nAccording to authorities, the suspect was armed with a high powered rifle. The suspect shot through the home's front door toward the officers.\n\nKissimmee Police Department Chief Jeffrey O'Dell (pictured) said Howard, who has been on the force for 10 years, was in 'grave critical condition' and his prognosis 'does not look good'\n\nThree out of four suspects believed to be involved in the shooting are currently in custody, O'Dell said. (AP) -- One police officer was killed and three wounded in nighttime shootings in two Florida cities where the officers were responding to suspected drug activity and reports of a suicide attempt, police said Saturday. In addition, two Pennsylvania state troopers were shot sand wounded Friday night.\n\nOne officer was killed and another gravely injured late Friday night in Kissimmee in central Florida just south of the theme park hub of Orlando. The other two officers were injured a couple of hours later in Jacksonville, one of them shot in both hands and the other in the stomach. Three of four suspects in the Kissimmee shooting were arrested, and the shooter in Jacksonville was shot and killed when police returned fire.\n\nIn Kissimmee, officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspects in an area of the city for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. Both had families, he said.\n\nThe officers were checking three of the suspects when a fourth opened fire. One of the original three suspects fled and was being sought, and the other three were arrested. Broadcaster WFTV showed aerial footage of police cars with lights flashing swarmed a housing complex as the search continued early Saturday morning.\n\nIn the northern Florida city of Jacksonville, police responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home where three other people were thought to be in danger, Sheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno said.\n\nA team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house, Bruno said. The suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded\n\nPENNSYLVANIA\n\nAuthorities say two Pennsylvania state troopers have been shot and a suspect killed outside a small-town store, south of Pittsburgh.\n\nState police say the troopers, both taken to hospitals after the Friday night shooting in Fairchance, were in stable condition.\n\nPolice said the encounter took place outside a Stop 'n Save in Fairchance, a borough about 52 miles south of Pittsburgh. They say that as the officers approached the man, he pulled out a gun from a backpack and fired it. They confirmed the suspect was shot.\n\nin the exchange of fire. The three other people in the house were safe, Bruno said.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott sent Tweets about the four officers, saying \"we stand with ALL law enforcement in Florida.\"\n\nWhen O'Dell held his brief news conference outside the hospital where the two fallen Kissimmee officers had been taken, reports already had surfaced of two more officers shot in Jacksonville to the north.\n\n\"It's a tough time for law enforcement,\" O'Dell said of those reports. {"id": "10055923", "categories": [{"id": 107, "label": "dmoz/Business/Business Services/Fire and Security", "uri": "dmoz/Business/Business_Services/Fire_and_Security", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 203, "label": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law Enforcement", "uri": "dmoz/Society/Law/Law_Enforcement", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711893237", "source": {"id": "2795", "title": "NewsMax", "uri": "newsmax.com"}, "url": "http://www.newsmax.com/Newsfront/US-Officers-Shot-Florida/2017/08/19/id/808539/", "body": "One police officer was killed and three wounded in nighttime shootings in two Florida cities where the officers were responding to suspected drug activity and reports of a suicide attempt, police said Saturday.\n\nOne officer was killed and another gravely injured late Friday night in Kissimmee in central Florida just south of the theme park hub of Orlando. The other two officers were injured a couple of hours later in Jacksonville, one of them shot in both hands and the other in the stomach. Three of four suspects in the Kissimmee shooting were arrested, and the shooter in Jacksonville was shot and killed when police returned fire.\n\nIn Kissimmee, officers Sam Howard and Matthew Baxter were checking suspects in an area of the city for drug activity when they were shot, Kissimmee Police Chief Jeff O'Dell said at a news conference. They did not have an opportunity to return fire.\n\n\"They were surprised,\" O'Dell said. When asked whether they were ambushed, he said, \"It's too early to tell, but it's leading that way.\"\n\nBaxter, a three-year veteran of the department, died later in a hospital and Howard, a 10-year veteran, was in serious condition, O'Dell said. Both had families, he said.\n\nFollowing the ambush, President Donald Trump took to Twitter to show his support:\n\n\"My thoughts and prayers are with the @KissimmeePolice and their loved ones. We are with you!\" He tweeted.\n\nMy thoughts and prayers are with the @KissimmeePolice and their loved ones. We are with you!#LESM -- Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nThe officers were checking three of the suspects when a fourth opened fire. One of the original three suspects fled and was being sought, and the other three were arrested. Broadcaster WFTV showed aerial footage of police cars with lights flashing swarmed a housing complex as the search continued early Saturday morning.\n\nIn the northern Florida city of Jacksonville, police responded to reports of an attempted suicide at a home where three other people were thought to be in danger, Sheriff's Office Director Mike Bruno said.\n\nA team of officers heard gunshots inside and feared \"an active shooter situation\" so they approached the house, Bruno said. The suspect then came out firing a high-powered rifle. He was shot and killed, and two of the police officers were wounded in the exchange of fire. The three other people in the house were safe, Bruno said.\n\nFlorida Gov. Rick Scott sent Tweets about the four officers, saying \"we stand with ALL law enforcement in Florida.\"\n\nWhen O'Dell held his brief news conference outside the hospital where the two fallen Kissimmee officers had been taken, reports already had surfaced of two more officers shot in Jacksonville to the north.\n\n\"It's a tough time for law enforcement,\" O'Dell said of those reports.
